intro: Diplopappus hispidus, commonly known as the hairy burrweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, hairy, spiny fruits called achenes, which are adapted for wind dispersal. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its morphology reflects its adaptation to arid environments, with reduced leaves and a compact growth form.
